channel.title: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine
channel.description:
[center][size=12pt][b]SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine[/b][/size][/center]
Here is the screen shot: http://img297.imageshack.us/img297/1376/scar303ubuntulinuxusingeq6.png
And also of my DFM Parser v.22 screen shot: http://img263.imageshack.us/img263/7125/dfmparserbyronubuntulinnf4.png
I'm running Ubuntu Linux 7.04 Feisty Fawn which came out on April 19th, 2007. My WINE version is: 0.9.33 In my computer for this to work, you need to have a dual boot between Ubuntu and Windows. Then have your C drive mounted on your desktop. After you have finished with that, just locate your SCAR installation folder, and run this command.
[code] wine scar.exe [/code]
Hope people enjoy coding in scar and running applications in Ubuntu! :D
~Ron

item.title: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

SCAR 3.06 works perfectly under all Windows Operating systems above Windows 95 in Ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

From that screenshot, it looks like there are a lot if fixmes. To speed it up, you may want to do something like this:

WINEDEBUG=-all wine scar.exe

To install fonts, just move them to the ~/.wine/drive_c/windows/fonts/ directory.

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine

item.title: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Freddy1990:

Just google how to load windows fonts in wine

Naw, too complicated for me to try and add them. Wine is supposed to run them properly, so I don’t think there is a way to fix that until Wine fixes it in their own program.

Forgot to mention, I tested this also for SCAR 3.04, but it wouldn’t work under Windows ME. I had to go down another notch. If you’re using 3.04, use Windows 98 as its operating system. I’ll check 3.05 when I boot into Linux.

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine

item.source: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine

item.title: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Freddy, I wish I knew how to change the fonts. Is there an option in SCAR or do you mean in Ubuntu itself?

The titles Edit, Script, and Help work if you emulate Windows ME.
Screenshot: http://img329.imageshack.us/img329/5494/54238770pq5.png

To do that, just follow these steps.

  1. After installing Wine, type in winecfg in the terminal.
  2. Click on the Applications tab, and click on Add Application.
  3. Locate scar.exe and double click on it to add it.
  4. Select scar.exe and look a little below and you will see “Windows Version.” Choose Windows ME and click on Apply or OK.
  5. Now locate your scar.exe file using the terminal – For me, I just put this in.
cd ../../media/sda1/program\ files/scar\ 3.03/
  1. Then just type in “wine scar.exe”

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine

item.source: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine

item.title: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Everything seems to work. Bitmaps, color finding, moving the mouse, sending text, activating clients, the target, dtms, waits, forms, and everything else. Except for three things. On the top navigation bar with the titles File, Edit, Script, etc, some of those buttons display an error. Those are Edit, Script, and Help. I get an access violation when I try to open those.

There are also a few strange things. Such as the code hints box. When you’re typing in something like FindColor( and the code hints thing opens up, it will only show 1 part of it. Such as…

FindColor( = thebox will then show “var x” instead of something like this.
FindColor(var x, y : integer; color, x1, y1, x2, y2 : integer);

But as you go on like this.
FindColor(x, y
then it will continue, and then show in the box “var y” and so on.

Last thing I have seen is the text. The text is pretty fucked up. You can see it from the screenshot. It’s really wacked out. Maybe if I emulated Windows XP instead.

I’ll post anything else I find different or just not right.

Read full topic
item.source: SCAR 3.03 Works On Linux Under Wine

Woah.

But but, Ron, did you at least try: using crosshair, color picking, mouse moving/clicking, typing, waiting, finding colors/DTMs/bitmaps and so on…

If it works perfectly (just like under Windows XP plz!!1), I WILL go for it.
